intro: Ceropegia aspera, commonly known as the rough-stemmed ceropegia, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting specific pollinators such as moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia aspera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
